minerals.name: Quartz
minerals.description: A hard, crystalline mineral composed of silicon and oxygen. It comes in many varieties, including amethyst, citrine, and rose quartz.
practical_purposes: Used in electronics as a piezoelectric material.
Used in watches and clocks for its oscillatory properties.

minerals.name: Diamond
minerals.description: A form of pure carbon with a cubic crystal structure, known for its exceptional hardness and brilliance.
practical_purposes: Industrial cutting, grinding, and drilling tools.

minerals.name: Gold
minerals.description: A precious metal known for its lustrous yellow color, malleability, and resistance to corrosion.
practical_purposes: Medical applications, such as in dentistry and cancer treatment.

minerals.name: Calcite
minerals.description: A carbonate mineral that is a major component of limestone and marble. It exhibits double refraction.
practical_purposes: Used in construction materials like cement and concrete.
Optical applications due to its birefringence.

minerals.name: Halite
minerals.description: Commonly known as rock salt, it forms isometric crystals and is essential for human life.
practical_purposes: Used as table salt and food preservative.

minerals.name: Graphite
minerals.description: A soft, layered form of carbon with a hexagonal crystal structure. It is a good conductor of electricity.

minerals.name: Magnetite
minerals.description: A magnetic iron oxide mineral that is an important ore of iron.
practical_purposes: Biomedical applications, such as drug delivery systems.

minerals.name: Bauxite
minerals.description: The primary ore of aluminum, it is a mixture of aluminum hydroxides and other minerals.
practical_purposes: Used in abrasives and refractory materials.

minerals.name: Fluorite
minerals.description: A colorful mineral that fluoresces under ultraviolet light. It has a cubic crystal structure.
practical_purposes: Used in the production of hydrofluoric acid.

minerals.name: Gypsum
minerals.description: A soft sulfate mineral that is widely used in construction. It forms as evaporite deposits.
practical_purposes: Primary component of drywall and plaster.

minerals.name: Talc
minerals.description: The softest known mineral, it has a greasy feel and is used in powders and cosmetics.
practical_purposes: Used in talcum powder and cosmetics.

minerals.name: Pyrite
minerals.description: Known as 'fool's gold,' it is a brassy-yellow mineral with a metallic luster.
practical_purposes: Source of sulfur in sulfuric acid production.
Used in jewelry as a decorative stone.
Historical use in early firearms (spark production).

minerals.name: Mica
minerals.description: A group of sheet silicate minerals that split into thin, flexible layers.
practical_purposes: Used in cosmetics for its shimmering effect.

minerals.name: Hematite
minerals.description: A common iron oxide mineral with a metallic to earthy luster. It is the primary ore of iron.

minerals.name: Sphalerite
minerals.description: The primary ore of zinc, it often contains traces of cadmium, gallium, and indium.
practical_purposes: Source of zinc for galvanization and alloys.
Used in the production of semiconductors.
Source of rare elements like indium.
